attributes.action: Stop the murder and torture of farmers in South Africa
attributes.additional_details: South African police fail to investigate or solve many of these murders, which are carried out by organized gangs, often armed with weapons that police have previously confiscated. The racial character of the killing is covered up by a SA government order prohibiting police from reporting murders by race. Instead the crisis is denied and the murders are dismissed as ordinary crime, ignoring the frequent mutilation of the victims’ bodies, a sure sign that these are hate crimes.
attributes.background: Afrikaner farm owners are being murdered at a rate four times the murder rate of other South Africans, including Black farm owners. Their families are also subjected to extremely high crime rates, including murder, rape, mutilation and torture of the victims.

rejection.details:
This isn't something that the UK Government or Parliament could do.

You could start a new petition calling on the UK Government to raise this issue with the South African Government.
